reviewText: These guys are hysterical.  Not only do they get funnier as the seasons go along and their characters continue to develop, but the story line gets more intricate, interesting and involved and the special effects become much more hard core and fun to watch.  I have to stop now or I'll go on for days about the unequaled awesomeness of Red vs. Blue.

reviewText: I won't go into WHAT Red vs Blue is because there is a very large chance that you already know about it and have decided to add it to your DVD collection. Good move, sir (or madam).The opening sequence of each episode has been removed, in lieu of just one opening sequence at the very beginning, essentially turning the episodes into one long running movie, averaging about 100 minutes per season. The quality of the videos are excellent, and they did some minor tweaking on the first season that may have not been available at the startup, such as editing out the 'aiming reticule' and cleaning up some of the dialogue where the tinny gave off a semi-garbled effect, which was originally due to some of the voice actors adding their dialogue by PHONE! Those facts, as well as MANY others are included in the MASSIVE bonus features on this collection. Seriously...a lot of Bonus Features.The guys at Rooster Teeth did it right the first time, making these DVD's the 'essential collections' right out of the box, so you're not missing anything...every short, every PSA, and every behind the scenes is included on each disc, adding hours of enjoyment to The Blood Gulch Chronicles.If you don't own ANY of Red vs Blue on DVD, I highly suggest this is the route you take as opposed to buying each disc, unless you like having all the different cases for each season (which is actually pretty cool too!).My advice, chuck out the few bucks and have some laughs with this hilarious, multiple award-winning machinima masterpiece!

reviewText: The great thing about this series is that it is based mostly on dialogue and not so much on the action of it all. So not only is the dialogue smart and funny but it is great for background noise while you're concentrating on another task at hand. Like RvB's Recollection, the extras are great and even the menu screens are entertaining. My only real beef with this is that they didn't include the one liners at the end of the episodes during the blackouts but for the sake of editing the 100 or so clips into a movie, I can understand that.

Title: N/A

reviewText: You can't go wrong here.  Red vs Blue was one of the best Machinima's I ever watched.  To think I used to watch them at 360p  and then 480p.  I remember watching the older, non - remastered versions where the cross-hair is still present and you actually are missing 1/2 the image (they had to crop out the arms/weapon of the camera man!).  The remastered set is fantastic.  The video looks great in widescreen, with drastically improved visuals compared to the original version we have all come to love.  The textures now look crystal clear and the image takes up the entire screen rather than half.  The audio has been improved as well, on top of some improved visual. Any Red vs Blue fan won't be disappointed.  Any Halo fan won't be either. If you are a gamer you can't miss this show especially in its remastered form on DVD
summary: Red vs Blue at its Finest

reviewText: You can hate Halo. Right down to the core. But the fellows at Rooster Teeth have taken the game and put a new spin on it creating humor through dialogue and situational dilemmas. Not for younger viewers though. Def watch this series!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Great collection, I would highly recommend to any Halo fan.This collection has the first 5 seasons, and for the most part EVERY extra they did in that time. This thing is overloaded with extra content, which is why I was drawn to it. There is the season, then about triple the content in extras! Red Vs Blue takes a turn in the story after season 5 (which would have been the end of the series) which may have turned some off if you are looking for just a comedy show, but these first seasons are pure comedic gold!Head over to Rooster teeth and watch a couple episodes and try out the podcast they do. If you like the podcast then commentary is perfect for you!The extras just sold it for me above all else, for the price it is worth checking out!Hope this helps,RW.
